chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Wendland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES:  15CF131, 15CF190 Defendant Matthew A Wendland in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Matthew A Wendland in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KJB clerk. 1022am State- was capped at 18 mos; recommendation violated that. Recess. 1113am back on record. Atty Repka- move forward today. 

15CF131: 2.5yrs prison, 1.5 IC, 1 ES- concurrent to 15CF190. $290.60 fine/cost. cannot possess firearm. cannot vote. 358 days sent credit. Not elig CIP, Is elig for SAP, could gain elig for Early Release Prog. 


15CF190: 5yrs prison, 3 IC, 2 ES- concurrent to any time serving in MN. $250 DNA surcharge. $290.60 fine/cost. PP of $20 to be paid out of prison wages to go towards restitution. cannot possess firearm. cannot vote. Restitution J/S with Diana Peterson & Sara Shenton. 358 days sent credit. Not elig CIP, Is elig for SAP, could gain elig for Early Release Prog.
